comment: Good rye whiskey, but a little on the sweet side. Very smooth though.
Hint of maple, not bad for a rye
Nice maple and cereal notes. In the mouth it is very spicy, and little undeveloped. Nice full mouth feel, maybe lingering a little long.
3.5, it’s a nice mix of spicy and sweet.
Easy finish, initial taste is sweet and mapley as the name suggests, builds a little in the middle but then hits you with a sneaky smooth finish which may be anti-climatic for some.
An all-rye beverage finished in maple barrels for extra sweetness. Ok. Not my thing.
Strange aftertaste on this one. Good concept, but the execution isn't quite right for me.
Yummy rye. Reminds of Dads Hat

Not too bad, sweet yet spicy. Enjoyed on ice. Reminded me a little of Coopers Daughter. Had an odd aftertaste that I could not put my finger on, but the aftertaste did not last long. Maybe that’s why I could not put my finger on the note LOL.
Batch 2 from 2017. Young rye with a very sweet maple and oak nose. The palette has the rye burn in the front middle, but the sweetness of the maple softens it up nice.
Overwhelmingly cinnamon flavored, cake across spiced. Not a fan
Honey flavors with pleasant spices.  Slightly sweeter than I prefer.

This is the 1st batch.

This one immediately noses like a red hot with rye, sweet maple syrup, and a little green banana.

The palate has an oily mouthfeel with a lot of cinnamon, vanilla and a very astringent thing going on.

This one has a medium finish that has a continuation of cinnamon and some astringency. 

I do not like this one. I don’t mind cinnamon, but this is like artificial cinnamon flavoring. It just seems off.
I think it's quite good.  I'm no expert but I love the subtle sweetness that's there.
If you love baking spices and oak, you'll love this. This is one of my five "island" whiskeys for sure!
didn't realize it was a rye when I ordered, answers my question as to the bite I got. maple definitely settled it down though
The maple cuts the heat of this whiskey. Not bad for a young whiskey.
Very impressive for a young whiskey, sweet and hides the heat.
spicy. smells and tastes some sweet - sugar, vanilla, maple. definitely maple. not unpleasant. spicy. tastes a little empty (is not full bodied i guess)
a bit too much burn on the end for my liking. better after the ice melts or with some cherry syrup
A tinge of sweetness. Add a drop of their bourbon barrel aged Maple syrup and it's just right.
Very smooth for a rye.  Tastes like a bourbon with just a hint of pepper corn.  Finish definitely has a nice maple sweetness to it.  I like it!
Smells interesting and has some interesting tasting notes, but altogether tastes a bit like varnish
